contradicting_spans: Faria, the beneficent and cheerful companion, with whom he was accustomed to live so intimately, no longer breathed.
reasoning: Contradiction (character): The character of Faria is directly contradictory to the claim that he convinced Dantès that religion and reason could be fused into one worldview.

analysis.claim_text: University lectures on Enlightenment science convinced him that religion and reason could be fused into one worldview.

sub_claims.text: Faria attended university lectures on Enlightenment science.
Faria was convinced that religion and reason could be fused into one worldview.
